alert.note: Alert for Clark; Madison (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 17 at 11:44PM EST until February 20 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Louisville
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Louisville has issued a Flood Advisory for the following rivers in Kentucky... Kentucky River at Ford Lock affecting Madison and Clark Counties. ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM THIS EVENING TO MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Kentucky River at Ford Lock. * WHEN...From this evening to Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 26.0 feet, Flooding occurs in low lying portions of Fort Boonesborough State Park. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 23.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 25.9 feet Sunday morning. - Action stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood stage is 26.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding is possible and rivers are forecast to exceed bankfull. If you are in the advisory area remain alert to possible flooding, or the possibility of the advisory being upgraded to a warning. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/lmk. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning.
